description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a). The same title appears in the preamble (fol. 2b-3a). Physical description: 19 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Red circle text-stops. The text is framed within two red lines. European paper with watermark. Two spine labels (vertical), reading respectively: "al-Āyāt al-maqṣūrah ʻalá al-abyāt al-maqṣūrah lil-shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Ṭabarī" (in Arabic script), and "50" (in Arabic and Western numerals). Origin: Copy completed in Jumād[á] Awwal 1107 [Dec. 1695-Janv. 1696] by ʻAbd al-Nāṣir al-Jazīrī (colophon, fol. 277a). Incipit: يا من منح الايمة الاعلام مقصورات الخيام الممدودة الاطناب ويا من مدح امة الاسلام في المبتداء والختام ... وبعد فان ابهي ما تتجمل به اجياد الانام وازمي ما تتكمل به جياد الايام التحلى بفضايل الوسيمة Explicit: وتب علينا انك انت التواب الرحيم واغفر لنا وارحمنا انك انت الغفور الرحيم
author: Ṭabarī, ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn Muḥammad, 1568 or 9-1623 or 4.
abstract: Commentary on al-Maqṣūrah by Abū Bakr Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan Ibn Durayd.
extent: i, 277, ii leaves: paper ; 200 x 136 (147 x 92) mm. bound to 205 x 145 mm.
provenance: Acquired by Robert Garrett from Brill, Leyden, 1925, from the books of Murād Bey al-Bārūdī (Beirut).
